Feature: Use fixed JDK version for releases

issue.title: Specify which Java version Cryptomator should use for testing, building and shipping, pin it and have it updated semi-automatically.
issue.body:
### Please agree to the following

- [X] I have searched [existing issues](https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator/issues?q=) for duplicates
- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator/blob/develop/.github/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)

### Summary

Specify which Java version Cryptomator should use for testing, building and shipping, pin it and have it updated semi-automatically.

### Motivation

For the https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator/releases/tag/1.9.4 we introduced https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator/commit/ef4738f92048a43f3a84dfb47738d229173fd367 because our Mac ARM runner did cache the Java runtime and therefore did not use the latest 20.0.2v Java version which was the reason for this release, see https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator/actions/runs/5784809971/job/15715418321

```
Run actions/setup-java@v3
  with:
    distribution: zulu
    java-version: 20
    java-package: jdk+fx
    architecture: aarch64
    cache: maven
    check-latest: false
    ...
  env:
    JAVA_VERSION: 20
Installed distributions
  Resolved Java 20.0.1+9 from tool-cache
  Setting Java 20.0.1+9 as the default
  Creating toolchains.xml for JDK version 20 from zulu
  Overwriting existing file /Users/quicksilver/.m2/toolchains.xml
  
  Java configuration:
    Distribution: zulu
    Version: 20.0.1+9
    Path: /Users/quicksilver/Developer/actions-runner/_work/_tool/Java_Zulu_jdk+fx/20.0.1-9/aarch64
  
Creating settings.xml with server-id: github
Overwriting existing file /Users/quicksilver/.m2/settings.xml
maven cache is not found
```

https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator/commit/ef4738f92048a43f3a84dfb47738d229173fd367 adds https://github.com/actions/setup-java/tree/main#check-latest for the release.

Maybe we should also enable it for all other CI builds otherwise it could happen that released version behaves differently than the tested variant. On the other side this still can happen because we only define we want to have an zulu Java 20 version, if after testing and before release another minor is released, the same would happen.

Therefore we should pin the exact version and update it semi-automatically (create an PR) using an bot so we have full control over it.


### Considered Alternatives

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_

pull_request.title: Feature: Use fixed JDK version for releases
pull_request.body:
Closes #3075.

This PR pins the JDK version used for building installers (release and testing), to prevent errors due to an JDK update (or missing). Additionally, it add as new workflow which notifies us, when an JDK update is present. The workflow runs once a month.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -43,7 +44,7 @@ jobs:
         run: |
           sudo add-apt-repository ppa:coffeelibs/openjdk
           sudo apt-get update
-          sudo apt-get install debhelper devscripts dput coffeelibs-jdk-${{ env.COFFEELIBS_JDK_VERSION }} libgtk2.0-0
+          sudo apt-get install debhelper devscripts dput coffeelibs-jdk-${{ env.COFFEELIBS_JDK }}:amd64=${{ env.COFFEELIBS_JDK_VERSION }} libgtk2.0-0

issue.title: Timestamps not preserved in vaults on SD Cards using Windows 10
issue.body:
### Please agree to the following

- [X] I have searched [existing issues](https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator/issues?q=) for duplicates
- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator/blob/develop/.github/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)

### Summary

Cryptomator is not keeping the timestamp of files when copied to a vault located on a SD card or on a USB stick. All timestamps for files, i.e. created/modified/accessed, are updated to current time when copied. For the folders the modified date timestamp is kept but the created date is changed to current time. This seems only to occur for SD cards and USB sticks. For hard disks (HD and SD drives) all works normally, also when the drives are connected with external USB enclosures. 

### What software is involved?

- Operating System: Windows 10 English
- Cryptomator: v1.91 and v1.92 with WinFsp v1.x (included in exe installer) and with WinFsp upgraded to winfsp-2.0.23075.msi
- Different SD Cards, USB sticks and Hard Disk Drives

### Volume Type

WinFsp

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Install Cryptomator on a HDD (with WinFsp as volume type).
2. Create a test vault on the HDD.
3. Open the vault and copy some files/folders from the HDD into the vault. Timestamps will be preserved. 
4. Close the vault, and copy it to a USB stick and/or SD Card. 
5. Open the vault in the new location and copy some files/folders from the HDD into it. All file timestamps will be updated to current time. 
6.  See further "Anything else?" below.


### Expected Behavior

File and folder timestamps to be preserved. 

### Actual Behavior

File and folder timestamps were not preserved. 

### Reproducibility

Always

### Relevant Log Output

_No response_

### Anything else?

Same timestamp behavior when the vault is created directly on the SD card or USB stick and files are copied to it from a HDD. 

This seems to occur only for SD cards and USB sticks. For hard disks (HD and SD drives) all works normally, also when the HDD is connected over an external USB enclosures. Tested several different times/ways and all worked well with HDD.

comment.body:
The problem is with the virtual drive type. Had the same problem with Windows 11 (NTFS) and external SSD drive (efFat). Using WinFsp, the timestamps are not preserved, but it does if I choose WebDAV Windows Explorer).

I had chosen WinFsp because WebDAV doesn't support files larger than 4 GB.

issue.title: Android app shows "strange" files that do not exists in vault
issue.body:
<!--
⚠️⚠️⚠️ READ CAREFULLY ⚠️⚠️⚠️

Do you want to ask a QUESTION? Are you looking for SUPPORT?
We're happy to help you via our support channels! Please read: https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator/blob/develop/SUPPORT.md

By filing an issue, you are expected to comply with our code of conduct: https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator/blob/develop/.github/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Of course, we also expect you to search for existing similar issues first! ;) https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator/issues?q=

⚠️ IMPORTANT: If you don't stick to this template, the issue will get closed. To proof that you read this, please remove the X from the following line:
-->
<!-- oooooo -->

### Description

Android app shows "strange" files (MSIxxx.tmp) that do not exists in vault, then it reports that a c9r file is missing. Pgm on Win10 doesn't show any "strange" files but into the debug there is the same notification for the same path. The actual path into Dropbox is indeed empty

### System Setup

- Operating system and version:
  - Windows 10 v2004 (build 19041.450)
  - Android 8.1.0 / API27
    - Device Moto G (5) Plus
- Cryptomator version: 1.5.10 (both on Win10 and Android)
* Volume type: Dokany

### Steps to Reproduce

1. just open the vault from Android
![Phone_20201126_a](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26879397/100359294-a107c280-2ff7-11eb-85ef-6e7983d9b527.png)
2. tap the "strange" entry

#### Expected Behavior

...just the same listing I see on the pc... :)

#### Actual Behavior

Error
![Phone_20201126_b](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26879397/100359549-00fe6900-2ff8-11eb-820f-a4a22759f367.png)
![Phone_20201126_c](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26879397/100359558-03f95980-2ff8-11eb-9ea0-203e8c773907.png)

#### Reproducibility

Always

Opening the actual path on Dropbox shows an empty folder...
![PC_20201126_142932](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26879397/100360172-e11b7500-2ff8-11eb-9681-9338956d3f97.png)
![PC_20201126_143024](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26879397/100360182-e4166580-2ff8-11eb-9cb0-9ac5d71cc74e.png)

Sample from my pc log
```
14:01:47.716 [DOKAN0] WARN  o.c.cryptofs.CryptoPathMapper - Did not find valid content inside of C:\Users\XYZ\Dropbox\Cryptomator\d\IJ\MBGGW35CWUCJO5GKXIHSYQTXK336Z3\Py0cAcLxN77ZZSutzD9JClLdgZEjMq76JiwE.c9r
14:01:47.734 [DOKAN0] WARN  o.c.frontend.dokany.ReadWriteAdapter - (17) findFilesWithPattern(): IO error accessing /MSI4ff8.tmp. Will be ignored in file listing. Reported Exception:
java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException: /MSI4ff8.tmp: Could not determine type of file C:\Users\XYZ\Dropbox\Cryptomator\d\IJ\MBGGW35CWUCJO5GKXIHSYQTXK336Z3\Py0cAcLxN77ZZSutzD9JClLdgZEjMq76JiwE.c9r
	at org.cryptomator.cryptofs.CryptoPathMapper.getCiphertextFileType(CryptoPathMapper.java:108)
	at org.cryptomator.cryptofs.attr.AttributeProvider.readAttributes(AttributeProvider.java:42)
	at org.cryptomator.cryptofs.CryptoFileSystemImpl.readAttributes(CryptoFileSystemImpl.java:239)
	at org.cryptomator.cryptofs.CryptoFileSystemProvider.readAttributes(CryptoFileSystemProvider.java:423)
	at java.base/java.nio.file.Files.readAttributes(Unknown Source)
	at org.cryptomator.frontend.dokany.ReadWriteAdapter.lambda$findFilesWithPattern$2(ReadWriteAdapter.java:542)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$3$1.accept(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.util.Iterator.forEachRemaining(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.util.Spliterators$IteratorSpliterator.forEachRemaining(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.ForEachOps$ForEachOp.evaluateSequential(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.ForEachOps$ForEachOp$OfRef.evaluateSequential(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.forEach(Unknown Source)
	at org.cryptomator.frontend.dokany.ReadWriteAdapter.findFilesWithPattern(ReadWriteAdapter.java:555)
	at com.dokany.java.DokanyOperationsProxy$FindFilesWithPatternProxy.callback(DokanyOperationsProxy.java:211)
	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at com.sun.jna.CallbackReference$DefaultCallbackProxy.invokeCallback(CallbackReference.java:520)
	at com.sun.jna.CallbackReference$DefaultCallbackProxy.callback(CallbackReference.java:551)
```

### Additional Information

This is the SECOND time I get these "strange" files! Yesterday (I do not use the Android app frequently!) I found many of these, about 20... I thought they were some leftover from the DB migration from v6 to v7, so I have:
- moved everything from the vault locally on my pc
- unmounted the vault
- the vault size was zero but a few folders were still there, deleting wasn't possibile
- on the actual Dropbox folder 99,9% of subfolders were 0 bytes, a few about 30 bytes
- deleted the actual Dropbox subfolders of "d"
- re-mounted the vault, now empty both from pc and Android
- moved back on vault everything from the local copy on pc
- at first the vault wasn't showing any "strange" files on Android

Today I saw the above TWO! :-(
BTW: I use FreeFileSync to save the vault on a safe place on my pc, this software creates and deletes many "temporary files"... could it be the problem?

[PC_cryptomator0_20201126_1430.zip](https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator/files/5603496/PC_cryptomator0_20201126_1430.zip)
[Phone_logs_20201126_1405.zip](https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator/files/5603499/Phone_logs_20201126_1405.zip)

comment.body: This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.

issue.title: Windows 7 Support
issue.body:
### Please agree to the following

- [X] I have searched [existing issues](https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator/issues?q=) for duplicates
- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/cryptomator/cryptomator/blob/develop/.github/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)

### Summary

Windows 7 isnt allowed anymore

### What software is involved?

- Operating System:  Windwos 7 x64 with ESC Updates
- Cryptomator:  1.51 - Cryptomator-1.10.1-x64 doenst work
- …


### Volume Type

None

### Steps to Reproduce

Windows 7 ESC

### Expected Behavior

Installation

### Actual Behavior

Installer Quits after tellning me to install the old version!

### Reproducibility

Always

### Relevant Log Output

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_
